intro: Combesia muscosa var. polpodacea, commonly known as the mossy combesia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
